definition: sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]

sentences.english: During this period you should arrange your home to reflect your grief and sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 这段期间内，家里的布置要有哀泣的气氛。

sentences.english: And through the dream the future wept, grieving for the lost tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 梦中的未来悲恸哀泣，追悼失落的明天。

sentences.english: Yet so they mourn becoming of their woe.
sentences.chinese: 这哀泣那么配合她们的悲痛。

sentences.english: During this period I will arrange my home to reflect my grief and sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 在这段期间内，家里的布置应该有哀泣的气氛。

sentences.english: Women in that town wailed for their dead.
sentences.chinese: 那个城市的女人们哀泣她们的亡人。

sentences.english: We saw their hope turn into a snare, and their rejoicing into weeping.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到他们的希望化为泡影，他们的欢乐变成哀泣。

definition: to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
